intro: Ervatamia subcapitata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eryngo, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a single, narrow umbel at the top of the stem. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, with a distinctive, slightly bitter taste. Ervatamia subcapitata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
